<!DOCTYPE html> 📚Inside the Gas | Sanaz’s Blog Sanaz’s Blog | Fa Tutorials Projects Blog Books 📚Inside the Gas April 14, 2025 · 2 min Shlomo Venezia’s story is one of survival and unimaginable hardship. Born into a poor Jewish-Italian community, his early life was relatively safe under the protection of the Italians, but everything changed when the Germans invaded and deported his family to Auschwitz. Tragically, his mother and sisters were killed upon arrival, likely in the gas chambers.

<!DOCTYPE html> 📚Suicide-shop | Sanaz’s Blog Sanaz’s Blog | Fa Tutorials Projects Blog Books 📚Suicide-shop April 17, 2024 · 1 min I read The Suicide Shop by Jean Teulé, and I really enjoyed it. At first, the idea of a shop that sells things for people who want to die sounds very dark and strange. But the book is actually funny in a very unusual way. It’s called dark comedy — where serious topics are shown in a funny or strange light.

<!DOCTYPE html> Projects | Sanaz’s Blog Sanaz’s Blog | Fa Tutorials Projects Blog Books Projects 🛠️Flask Project Getting Started with Flask: A Super Simple Guide for Beginners If you’re new to Python web development, Flask is the perfect place to start! It’s lightweight, beginner-friendly, and lets you build web apps quickly. Let’s walk through a very simple Flask project, explain every line in detail: 🔧 What is Flask? Flask is a small Python framework used to build websites and web applications.
<!DOCTYPE html> Tags | Sanaz’s Blog Sanaz’s Blog | Fa Tutorials Projects Blog Books Tags books 2 projects 1 tutorial 1 © 2025 Sanaz’s Blog · Powered by Hugo & PaperMod

<!DOCTYPE html> Tutorials | Sanaz’s Blog Sanaz’s Blog | Fa Tutorials Projects Blog Books Tutorials WEB DEVELOPMENT LEARNING 🌐 Web Development Learning! 🔍 Overview This tutorial will guide you step-by-step through building a full-stack web application using: React.js for the frontend (user interface) Flask for the backend (server and API) MongoDB for the database (data storage) Docker to run each part in its own container You’ll learn how to build, connect, and run each component separately — just like in a professional web development environment.
